document.title: Visual and Performing Arts Content Standards for California Public Schools, Prekindergarten Through Grade Twelve

FCE59100DFE30131981E68A86D17958E.description: Read biographies and stories about artists and summarize the readings in short reports, telling how the artists mirrored or affected their time period or culture.

FCE50800DFE30131981C68A86D17958E.description: Construct diagrams, maps, graphs, timelines, and illustrations to communicate ideas or tell a story about a historical event.

FCE47930DFE30131981A68A86D17958E.description: Identify through research twentieth-century artists who have incorporated symmetry as a part of their work and then create a work of art, using bilateral or radial symmetry.

FCE41BD0DFE30131981968A86D17958E.description: Select a nonobjective painting, work in small groups to interpret it through dance/movement, and then write a paragraph reporting on the arts experience.

FCE372C0DFE30131981768A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in the Visual Arts to Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FCE32150DFE30131981668A86D17958E.description: Describe how the individual experiences of an artist may influence the development of specific works of art.

FCE2D3A0DFE30131981568A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe how various cultures define and value art differently.

FCE23960DFE30131981368A86D17958E.description: Discuss how the subject and selection of media relate to the meaning or purpose of a work of art.

FCE1F480DFE30131981268A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe how a person's own cultural context influences individual re-sponses to works of art.

FCE1ADB0DFE30131981168A86D17958E.description: Describe how using the language of the visual arts helps to clarify personal responses to works of art.

FCE11220DFE30131980F68A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works in the Visual Arts

FCE0BA30DFE30131980E68A86D17958E.description: Research and describe the influence of religious groups on art and architecture, focusing primarily on buildings in California both past and present.

FCE06660DFE30131980D68A86D17958E.description: Identify and discuss the content of works of art in the past and present, focusing on the different cultures that have contributed to California's history and art heritage.

FCDFDB70DFE30131980B68A86D17958E.description: Describe how art plays a role in reflecting life (e.g., in photography, quilts, architecture).

FCDF9210DFE30131980A68A86D17958E.description: Role and Development of the Visual Arts

FCDF4840DFE30131980968A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of the Visual Arts

FCDEFB90DFE30131980868A86D17958E.description: Use complementary colors in an original composition to show contrast and emphasis.

FCDEA5A0DFE30131980768A86D17958E.description: Use contrast (light and dark) expressively in an original work of art.

FCDE6090DFE30131980668A86D17958E.description: Use the interaction between positive and negative space expressively in a work of art.

FCDE1CF0DFE30131980568A86D17958E.description: Use accurate proportions to create an expressive portrait or a figure drawing or painting.

FCDDD7D0DFE30131980468A86D17958E.description: Communication and Expression Through Original Works of Art

FCDD91F0DFE30131980368A86D17958E.description: Use fibers or other materials to create a simple weaving.

FCDD4490DFE30131980268A86D17958E.description: Use additive and subtractive processes in making simple sculptural forms.

FCDCFAA0DFE30131980168A86D17958E.description: Use the conventions of facial and figure proportions in a figure study.

FCDCAA00DFE30131980068A86D17958E.description: Use shading (value) to transform a two-dimensional shape into what appears to be a three-dimensional form (e.g., circle to sphere).

FCDBFA50DFE3013197FE68A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in the Visual Arts

FCDBA180DFE3013197FD68A86D17958E.description: Describe the concept of proportion (in face, figure) as used in works of art.

FCDB3B20DFE3013197FC68A86D17958E.description: Identify pairs of complementary colors (e.g., yellow/violet; red/green; orange/blue) and discuss how artists use them to communicate an idea or mood.

FCDAD8D0DFE3013197FB68A86D17958E.description: Describe how negative shapes/forms and positive shapes/forms are used in a chosen work of art.

FCDA9270DFE3013197FA68A86D17958E.description: Perceive and describe contrast and emphasis in works of art and in the environment.

FCDA0120DFE3013197F868A86D17958E.description: Describe and analyze the elements of art (e.g., color, shape/form, line, texture, space, value), emphasizing form, as they are used in works of art and found in the environment.

FCD9B7F0DFE3013197F768A86D17958E.description: Analyze Art Elements and Principles of Design

FCD96070DFE3013197F668A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to the Visual Arts

FCD8C7F0DFE3013197F468A86D17958E.description: Exhibit team identity and commitment to purpose when participating in theatrical experiences.

FCD82CE0DFE3013197F268A86D17958E.description: Use improvisation and dramatization to explore concepts in other content areas.

FCD72800DFE3013197EF68A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Theatre, Film/Video, and Electronic Media to Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FCD6C350DFE3013197EE68A86D17958E.description: Describe students' responses to a work of theatre and explain what the scriptwriter did to elicit those responses.

FCD67600DFE3013197ED68A86D17958E.description: Derivation of Meaning from Works of Theatre

FCD62860DFE3013197EC68A86D17958E.description: Compare and contrast the impact on the audience of theatre, film, television, radio, and other media.

FCD5D200DFE3013197EB68A86D17958E.description: Develop and apply appropriate criteria or rubrics for critiquing performances as to characterization, diction, pacing, gesture, and movement.

FCD50AD0DFE3013197E968A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Critiquing Theatrical Experiences

FCD4C300DFE3013197E868A86D17958E.description: Recognize key developments in the entertainment industry in California, such as the introduction of silent movies, animation, radio and television broadcasting, and interac-tive video.

FCD41B10DFE3013197E668A86D17958E.description: Identify theatrical or storytelling traditions in the cultures of ethnic groups throughout the history of California.

FCD3D1E0DFE3013197E568A86D17958E.description: Role and Cultural Significance of Theatre

FCD388D0DFE3013197E468A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Theatre

FCD33F00DFE3013197E368A86D17958E.description: Design or create costumes, props, makeup, or masks to communicate a character in formal or informal performances.

FCD2F3A0DFE3013197E268A86D17958E.description: Retell or improvise stories from classroom literature in a variety of tones (gossipy, sorrowful, comic, frightened, joyful, sarcastic).

FCD24510DFE3013197E068A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the emotional traits of a character through gesture and action.

FCD19930DFE3013197DE68A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Theatre

FCD14EA0DFE3013197DD68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate how voice (diction, pace, and volume) may be used to explore multiple possibilities for a live reading. Examples: "I want you to go." "I want you to go." "I want you to go."

FCD10090DFE3013197DC68A86D17958E.description: Identify a character's objectives and motivations to explain that character's behavior.

FCD0AB90DFE3013197DB68A86D17958E.description: Comprehension and Analysis of the Elements of Theatre

FCD05DE0DFE3013197DA68A86D17958E.description: Use the vocabulary of theatre, such as plot, conflict, climax, resolution, tone, objectives, motivation, and stock characters, to describe theatrical experiences.

FCD009A0DFE3013197D968A86D17958E.description: Development of the Vocabulary of Theatre

FCCF9B30DFE3013197D868A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Theatre

FCCEE970DFE3013197D668A86D17958E.description: Evaluate improvement in personal musical performances after practice or rehearsal.

FCCE5AD0DFE3013197D468A86D17958E.description: Relate dance movements to express musical elements or represent musical intent in specific music.

FCCE1140DFE3013197D368A86D17958E.description: Integrate several art disciplines (dance, music, theatre, or the visual arts) into a well-organized presentation or performance.

FCCDC700DFE3013197D268A86D17958E.description: Identify and interpret expressive characteristics in works of art and music.

FCCD1340DFE3013197D068A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Music to Learning in Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FCCCBE40DFE3013197CF68A86D17958E.description: Use specific criteria when judging the relative quality of musical performances.

FCCC1D40DFE3013197CD68A86D17958E.description: Describe the characteristics that make a performance a work of art.

FCCB6940DFE3013197CB68A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works of Music

FCCB2200DFE3013197CA68A86D17958E.description: Explain the relationship between music and events in history.

FCCA8E90DFE3013197C868A86D17958E.description: Recognize the influence of various cultures on music in California.

FCCA4100DFE3013197C768A86D17958E.description: Compare musical styles from two or more cultures.

FCC9EF20DFE3013197C668A86D17958E.description: Sing and play music from diverse cultures and time periods.

FCC99080DFE3013197C568A86D17958E.description: Identify music from diverse cultures and time periods.

FCC904E0DFE3013197C368A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Music

FCC8BE60DFE3013197C268A86D17958E.description: Compose and improvise simple rhythmic and melodic patterns on classroom instru-ments.

FCC82CF0DFE3013197C068A86D17958E.description: Use classroom instruments to play melodies and accompaniments from a varied reper-toire of music from diverse cultures, including rounds, descants, and ostinatos, by oneself and with others.

FCC7D780DFE3013197BF68A86D17958E.description: Sing a varied repertoire of music from diverse cultures, including rounds, descants, and songs with ostinatos, alone and with others.

FCC73CD0DFE3013197BD68A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Music

FCC6F040DFE3013197BC68A86D17958E.description: Recognize and describe aural examples of musical forms, including rondo.

FCC6A520DFE3013197BB68A86D17958E.description: Classify how a variety of instruments from diverse cultures produce sound (e.g., idiophone, aerophone, chordaphone, membranophone).

FCC65540DFE3013197BA68A86D17958E.description: Describe music according to its elements, using the terminology of music.

FCC5FE80DFE3013197B968A86D17958E.description: Listen to, Analyze, and Describe Music

FCC5A7E0DFE3013197B868A86D17958E.description: Read, write, and perform rhythmic notation, including sixteenth notes, dotted notes, and syncopation (e.g., eighth/quarter/eighth note and eighth-rest/quarter/eighth note).

FCC55410DFE3013197B768A86D17958E.description: Read, write, and perform diatonic scales.

FCC4ED40DFE3013197B668A86D17958E.description: Read, write, and perform melodic notation for simple songs in major keys, using solfège.

FCC42B50DFE3013197B468A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Music

FCC39AD0DFE3013197B268A86D17958E.description: Analyze the choreographic process and its relation to the writing process (e.g., brain-storming, exploring and developing ideas, putting ideas into a form, sequencing).

FCC35360DFE3013197B168A86D17958E.description: Development of Life Skills and Career Competencies

FCC30A00DFE3013197B068A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate a recognition of personal space and respect for the personal space of others.

FCC2BA20DFE3013197AF68A86D17958E.description: Describe how dancing develops strength, flexibility, and endurance in accordance with physical education standards.

FCC26210DFE3013197AE68A86D17958E.description: Explain how dance practice relates to and uses the vocabulary of other art subjects (e.g., positive and negative space, shape, line, rhythm, character).

FCC1D4E0DFE3013197AC68A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Dance to Learning in Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FCC18EB0DFE3013197AB68A86D17958E.description: List the expectations the audience has for a performer and vice versa.

FCC14770DFE3013197AA68A86D17958E.description: Describe ways in which a dancer effectively communicates ideas and moods (strong technique, projection, and expression).

FCC09FB0DFE3013197A868A86D17958E.description: Name and use specific criteria in assessing personal and professional dance choreogra-phy (e.g., contrast, phrasing, unity).

FCC04940DFE3013197A768A86D17958E.description: Use dance vocabulary to describe unique characteristics of dances they have watched or performed from countries studied in the history–social science curriculum (e.g., rhythms, spatial patterns, gestures, intent).

FCBFF370DFE3013197A668A86D17958E.description: Description, Analysis, and Criticism of Dance

FCBFA800DFE3013197A568A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works of Dance

FCBF5940DFE3013197A468A86D17958E.description: Perform and identify folk/traditional and social dances from California history.

FCBEB100DFE3013197A268A86D17958E.description: Perform and describe dances that reflect the geographical place in which the dances are performed (e.g., deserts, rain forests, islands).

FCBE20A0DFE3013197A068A86D17958E.description: Name the musical accompaniment and explain how it relates to the dances they have studied.

FCBDD9D0DFE30131979F68A86D17958E.description: Perform and identify dances from various countries with different arrangements of dancers (e.g., lines, circles, couples).

FCBD3640DFE30131979D68A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Dance

FCBCEFA0DFE30131979C68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate additional partner and group skills (e.g., imitating, leading/following, mirroring, calling/responding, echoing).

FCBCA910DFE30131979B68A86D17958E.description: Development of Partner and Group Skills

FCBC6310DFE30131979A68A86D17958E.description: Perform improvised movement and dance studies with focus and expression.

FCBC1A10DFE30131979968A86D17958E.description: Convey a range of feelings through shape/postures and movements when performing for peers.

FCB9E920DFE30131979768A86D17958E.description: Create a dance study that has a beginning, a middle, and an end. Review, revise, and refine.

FCB96F40DFE30131979668A86D17958E.description: Describe, discuss, and analyze the process used by choreographers to create a dance.

FCB8FFB0DFE30131979568A86D17958E.description: Application of Choreographic Principles and Processes to Creating Dance

FCB815C0DFE30131979368A86D17958E.description: Create, develop, and memorize set movement patterns and sequences.

FCB73C40DFE30131979168A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Dance

FCB6D240DFE30131979068A86D17958E.description: Identify, define, and use phrasing in dances learned or observed.

FCB67590DFE30131978F68A86D17958E.description: Describe a specific movement, using appropriate dance vocabulary.

FCB5AE60DFE30131978D68A86D17958E.description: Explain the principles of variety, contrast, and unity and apply to a dance sequence.

FCB55630DFE30131978C68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate increased range and use of space, time, and force/energy concepts (e.g., pulse/accents, melt/collapse, weak/strong).

FCB50D20DFE30131978B68A86D17958E.description: Comprehension and Analysis of Dance Elements

FCB4C790DFE30131978A68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to use smooth transitions when connecting one movement phrase to another.

FCB48210DFE30131978968A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate mental concentration and physical control in performing dance skills.

FCB43BB0DFE30131978868A86D17958E.description: Development of Motor Skills and Technical Expertise

FCB3F2F0DFE30131978768A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception – Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Dance
